meanings.definition: The quality or state of being undemonstrative.
meanings.sent1: Her undemonstrativenesses made it hard to know what she was thinking.
meanings.sent2: The undemonstrativenesses of the detective kept his true intentions hidden.
meanings.sent3: Despite his undemonstrativenesses, his love for her was evident in his actions.
meanings.sent4: The undemonstrativenesses of the lake's surface belied the strong currents underneath.
meanings.sent5: The undemonstrativenesses of the old house gave it an air of mystery.

meanings.definition: The lack of outward display of emotions or feelings.
meanings.sent1: His undemonstrativenesses made it difficult for others to understand his true emotions.
meanings.sent2: She found comfort in his undemonstrativenesses during times of distress.
meanings.sent3: The undemonstrativenesses of the cat amused the children, who tried to make it purr.
meanings.sent4: The undemonstrativenesses of the storm clouds foreshadowed the impending rain.
meanings.sent5: The undemonstrativenesses of the actor on stage left the audience wondering about his character's true intentions.
